DOC.brief_summary: In the FINS study we test - in a randomized non blinded intervention study- the hypothesis that increased intake of herring and mackerel will improve cognitive performance of children aged 4 years to 5 years 8 months in the Munich area (Germany), who habitually consume little fish.
DOC.brief_title: Herring and Mackerel Intervention and Learning Abilities
DOC.detailed_description: Long chain polyunsaturated fatty acids (LC-PUFA) of the n-3 series, eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA) and most prominently docosahexaenoic acid (DHA), are considered important for neural development during pre- and postnatal development.
DOC.criteria: 46 years severe illness child dislikes fish
